page.title: South Africa women's national football team

{{Infobox national football team | Name = South Africa | Badge = | Nickname = Banyana Banyana | Association = [[South African Football Association|South African
Football Association]] | Confederation = [[Confederation of African Football|CAF]] ([[Africa]]) | Coach = | Most caps = | Top scorer = | Home Stadium = | FIFA Trigramme = RSA | FIFA Rank = 67 |1st ranking date = July 2003 |FIFA max = 54 |FIFA max date = March 2009 |FIFA min = 74 |FIFA min date = June 2005 | Elo Rank = | pattern_la1=_rsa10h|pattern_b1=_rsa10h|pattern_ra1=_rsa10h|pattern_sh1=_esp_08 | leftarm1=019585|body1=019585|rightarm1=019585|shorts1=008000|socks1=F7EB29 | pattern_la2=_rsa10a|pattern_b2=_rsa10a|pattern_ra2=_rsa10a|pattern_sh2=_rsa10a | leftarm2=019585|body2=019585|rightarm2=019585|shorts2=F7EB29|socks2=008000 | First game = | Largest win = | Largest loss = | World cup apps = | World cup first = â | World cup best = â | Regional name = [[African Women's Championship]] | Regional cup apps = 9 | Regional cup first = [[1995 Women's African Football Championship|1995]] | Regional cup best = Runners up, [[1995 Women's African Football Championship|1995]]|, [[2000 Women's African Football Championship|2000]] and [[2008 Women's African Football Championship|2008]]| | type = women }} The '''South Africa national women's football team''', nicknamed ''Banyana Banyana'' (The Girls), is the national team of [[South Africa]] and is controlled by the [[South African Football Association]]. Their first official match was held in 30 May 1993 against [[Swaziland women's national football team|Swaziland]].{{cite web|url=http://www.safa.net/index.php?page=banyana|title=Senior National Women's Team|publisher=[[South African Football Association]]|accessdate=14 September 2011}} They qualified for the [[Football at the Summer Olympics|Olympic football]] for the first time in [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics|2012 tournament]],{{cite web|url=http://www.fifa.com/womensolympic/news/newsid=1509322/index.html|title=Banyana secure historic passage to London|publisher=[[FIFA]]|date=2011-09-12|accessdate=2011-09-13}} while at that time they have not been qualified for [[FIFA Women's World Cup]] yet. ==World Cup record== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width:50%;" |- !colspan=10|World Cup Finals |- !Year !Result !GP !W !D* !L !GF !GA !GD |- ||{{flagicon|China|}} [[1991 FIFA Women's World Cup|1991]]||''Did Not Enter''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|Sweden}} [[1995 FIFA Women's World Cup|1995]]||''Did Not Qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|USA}} [[1999 FIFA Women's World Cup|1999]]||''Did Not Qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|USA}} [[2003 FIFA Women's World Cup|2003]]||''Did Not Qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|China}} [[2007 FIFA Women's World Cup|2007]]||''Did Not Qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|Germany}} [[2011 FIFA Women's World Cup|2011]]||''Did Not Qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|Canada}} [[2015 FIFA Women's World Cup|2015]]||''To Be Determined''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- |'''Total'''||0/6||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |} :''*Draws include knockout matches decided on [[penalty shootout (football)|penalty kicks]].'' ==Olympic Games record== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width:50%;" |- !colspan=10|Olympic Games Finals |- !Year !Result !GP !W !D* !L !GF !GA !GD |- ||{{flagicon|United States}} [[Football at the 1996 Summer Olympics|1996]]||''Did Not Qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|Australia}} [[Football at the 2000 Summer Olympics|2000]]||''Did Not Qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|Greece}} [[Football at the 2004 Summer Olympics|2004]]||''Did Not Qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|China}} [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics|2008]]||''Did Not Qualify''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- ||{{flagicon|Great Britain}} [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics|2012]]||Qualified||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- |'''Total'''||1/5||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |} :''*Draws include knockout matches decided on [[penalty shootout (football)|penalty kicks]].'' ==Performance in Africa Women's Championship== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; width:50%;" !colspan=10|[[CAF Women's Championship]] |- !Year !Round !GP !W !D* !L !GS !GA !GD |- | [[1991 Women's African Football Championship|1991]]||''Did Not Enter''||-||-||-||-||-||-||- |- bgcolor=silver | [[1995 Women's African Football Championship|1995]]||Runners Up||6||3||1||2||19||20||â1 |- |{{flagicon|NGA}} [[1998 Women's African Football Championship|1998]]||Group Stage||2||0||0||2||2||7||â5 |- |{{flagicon|ZAF}} [[2000 Women's African Football Championship|2000]]||Group Stage||5||4||0||1||9||3||+6 |- |{{flagicon|NGA}} [[2002 Women's African Football Championship|2002]]||Fourth Place||5||2||1||2||6||11||â5 |- |{{flagicon|ZAF}} [[2004 Women's African Football Championship|2004]]||Group Stage||3||0||0||3||2||7||â5 |- bgcolor=cfaa88 |{{flagicon|NGA}} [[2006 Women's African Football Championship|2006]]||Third Place||5||2||1||2||8||5||+3 |- bgcolor=silver |{{flagicon|EQG}} [[2008 Women's African Football Championship|2008]]||Runners Up||5||3||0||2||7||4||+3 |- bgcolor=cfaa88 |{{flagicon|RSA}} [[2010 African Women's Football Championship|2010]]||Third Place||5||3||1||1||10||6||+4 |- |'''Total'''||'''Runners Up 2 Times'''||36||17||4||15||63||63||0 |} :''*Draws include knockout matches decided on [[penalty shootout (football)|penalty kicks]].'' ==Current squad== Due to a fixture clash between the All-Africa Games and the Olympic qualifiers, two separate teams were called up. A 16-woman squad has been called up for the [[Football at the 2011 All-Africa Games â Women's tournament|2011 All-Africa Games]] to be held in [[Mozambique]] from 3 to 18 September 2010.{{cite web|title=Team SA named for All Africa Games |url=http://www.sowetanlive.co.za/sport/2011/08/25/team-sa-named-for-all-africa-games|publisher=The Sowetan|date=25 August 2011|accessdate=25 August 2011}} *Yolula Tsawe *Ntshetsana Mputle *Sibongiseni Khamlana *Nthabeleng Modiko *Nondyebo Mgudu *Emily Mogatla *Matha Mokoma *Nomvula Kgoale *Chantelle Esau *Nocawe Sikiti *Sisebo Mabatle *Tina Selepe *Memory Makhanya *Nomakhosi Zulu *Andisiwe Mgcoyi *Mantombi Radebe An 18-women squad has been called up for a 2012 Olympic qualifier against Ethiopia.{{cite web|title=Banyana Banyana confident about qualifying for the 2012 London Olympic games|url=http://www.safa.net/index.php?page=articles&id=519|publisher=SAFA|date=8 September 2011|accessdate=12 September 2011}} {{nat fs g start}} {{nat fs g player|no=1|pos=GK |name=[[Thokozile Mndaweni]]|age= |caps= |goals= |club=[[Croesus FC|Croesus]] |clubnat=RSA}} {{nat fs g player|no=2|pos=GK |name=[[Andile Dlamini]]|age= |caps= |goals= |club= [[Mamelodi Sundowns F.C.|Sundowns Ladies]]|clubnat=RSA}} |----- !
